name: upbringing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 the way in which you are treated and educated when young, especially by your parents, especially in relation to the effect that this has on how you behave and make moral decisions: Is it right to say all the crimes he committed were simply the result of his upbringing? See also
bring someone up
More examplesFewer examplesThe children had had a harsh upbringing.Is it right to say all the crimes he committed were simply the result of his upbringing?I wonder what it was about her upbringing that made her so insecure.He rebelled against his strict upbringing.Your Dad's upbringing was totally different to mine.
